title: Solid
author: Jay P
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2025
review_text: Used almost the entire box for a Halloween costume project, primarily to hold EVA foam pieces together. The sheer amount of product is the value here. For the most part it does the job. I did experience some inconsistent performance with more weight-bearing applications, both with the hook and loop as well as with the adhesive. I won't be pulling apart the attached pieces apart often, if at all, but I would have reasonable concerns about the long-term sticking power (hook and loop - and - adhesive) if I did. I've used other brands before that I trusted that are no longer available, and while I would buy this item again, my level of confidence isn't quite as high. But, for semi-permanent usage with minimal weight-bearing, it's solid.

review_text: I purchased hook and loop strips for our outdoor couch/patio furniture to help prevent the wind from tossing the cushions off the furniture. I've tried other brands but they didn’t provide a strong enough hold. Since using this, we haven't had any issues with the velcro detaching from the cushions or the furniture. Everything has stayed in place. I appreciate the large size and strength of the hook and loop strips. You get a lot for the price.

title: If you're hanging art? These probably aren't for you.
author: H. A.
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2025
review_text:
If you're like me and have a ton of art to hang, you might be looking for a Command Strip alternative that isn't as expensive. Unfortunately, these don't quite fit the bill.
They might be great for mounting other things, or securing carpets etc, but if you're trying to hang frames (light ones, even!), these will not be a suitable alternative to Command Strips for the vast majority of what you need to hang.
Pros:
Very sticky.
Don't seem to damage walls unless the paint is already kind of sketchy, which is a big deal!
Unfortunately, these just didn't serve my needs, and despite lots of reviews, I really had to post this one. I've had several pieces of art just fall off the wall out of nowhere, and that's really frustrating. No breakage yet, but I'm not going to be waiting to see if that happens. I'll just be spending the money on big Command Strip.

title: Strong Hold - My New Favorite for Decorating
author: Customer Review
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2025
review_text:
Command Garland Holder comes with 6 holders and 12 adhesive strips. Each holder can hold 2 lbs which when used for garland covered in Christmas decor like I do with spacing these out up the stair banister it can hold quite a bit of weight. Have had no issues with falling off or coming off the wall entirely. I love the green color to blend with greenery to make it less noticeable.
I absolutely love these! I want to get more now I can place garland just about anywhere this holiday season my heart desires! Plus can actually leave up year round and decorate not just fall and Christmas! I used all 6 already but would like to try using for cord management on my next order! Can't wait! Highly recommend!

title: The green color makes these so much better for the holidays
author: It's Just Me
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2025
review_text:
I’ve used Command strips to hold up holiday decorations before, mainly colorful light cords. It was unfortunate that the light cords are green cords while the Command strips were white. Not anymore! These green strips will just blend right in. It seems reasonable to pay $2 extra for the green, over they grey, especially since Command strips are good value for the money anyway, IMHO. The size is appropriate for light strips or garlands.
In a test run, I found these strips to be easy to use. The adhesive’s stickiness is appropriate, as these held up just fine under the weight of the cords with lights. I weighed out 2 lbs. of coiled cable and these strips held that just fine, so the weight capacity they state is accurate.
I also have one of these doing cord management for my aquarium, since the background is green too. It works well there too.

title: How does this happen

date: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2025
review_text: I received a bag with 6 of the bundlers, not packaged and no command strips. I don't even understand.

title: Great for garland, not for wreaths
author: Angelady
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2025
review_text: These are of the quality you would expect from Command. The size is great for hanging garland. If your wreath has a loop or string on the back, this would work for it, but I think this style is best for garland. It would not go all the way around a wreath. The color blends well with garlic and wreath colors. I don't understand why the green ones are more expensive than the grey ones, though. I think they are a little overpriced, especially since most garlands would require more than one set. I wish more came in the kit. I can see these being perfect for holding other things in place, like cords from my desk, too.

title: Good for hanging garland / Great for managing cords
author: B. Young
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2025
review_text:
This review is for: Command Garland Holder, Fireplace Mantle Garland Holder for Displaying Garlands, Wreaths, and Holiday Decor Without Leaving Damage, Holes, or Residue, Holds 2lbs, Green, 6 Pack
I only need 2 of these to hang a garland over my door, when the time comes, and it seems like it will do a good job. Since I had left over hangers, I read some reviews and saw that some people were using these to manage their cords on appliances that did not have a good place to store the cords when not in use. I tried it on my shop vac and although it doesn't look pretty, it does stop me from tripping on the cord when I'm dragging my vaccuum from place to place. It has held well on the stainless steel surface and is easy to open and close by sliding the catch out of the slot.

title: Convenient, durable

review_text: I have used the clear version of these to collect excess cords, and use one outside my RV to hand the dog’s tie-out when not in use.

title: Practical, Reusable Low-Profile Solution
author: Lawgig
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2025
review_text: These are exactly what they claim to be. They are simple, functional, and easy to use. The green blends in well with most holiday décor, and installation is as straightforward as you’d expect from Command products. It grips securely so far, though it’s still early to say how well it will hold up once the garland’s full weight and time come into play. For now, it’s a neat, damage-free option for decorating without nails or hooks.

review_text: These are great to hang up my fake garland. It blends in with the color of it and holds well. My garland is pretty light so it’s sturdy. I would t use too heavy things in it. Perfect fit and function.

author: T. R.
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2025
review_text:
Quite sure that 3M markets this same item as a cable holder and made these green ones specifically for holiday decorations - but either way, they work great! I use 3M hooks and holders throughout my house and these are no different. I put these on my mantle to hold some battery powered Halloween string lights.
They can also be put up on the side of a desk to hang excess cable thru or to run a cord somewhere. They are a great utility item to keep in the drawer. The included tapes stick great just like other 3M hooks and clips.

title: These work very well

date: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2025
review_text: These work great they hold everything in place even heavy stuff and they don’t leave behind any damage

title: Really nice garland hangers- also for power cords too!
author: DeltaDanny
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2025
review_text:
It's a few weeks early to hang the garland, but I used one of these to secure a power cord on the back of a kitchen appliance. IT WORKED FANTASTIC!
The 3m tape stuck solid and performs well with nice amount of sticky. The hanger is sturdy and nice and easy to use. Color perfect for Christmas and not too off for other things as well. This is Steph perfect way to organize those cables. These will be used not just at Christmas but all through the year. Great value. Versatile as it's thick enough for cables and flexible enough to other smaller things. Five stars.

title: Higher quality than expected
author: Web
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2025
review_text: I expected relatively cheap plastic hangers that essentially snapped together, but was pleasantly surprised. The plastic feels like quality rubber that's sturdy but bends easily while the ends attach by sliding one into the grooves of the other. It forms a very secure latch when positioned vertically and should work in most cases horizontally as well. They're also reusable; just buy some more Command adhesive strips -- they use the standard size.

title: Haul Out the Holly
author: Pooke
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2025
review_text:
Finding a way to hang garland on my fireplace mantle has been a constant battle. I don’t want to put nail holes in it, yet finding a way to keep the garland from falling has forced me to use a few. I always tried to use little ones, not too many, and didn’t pound the nails very deep. It has been an uneasy situation every Christmas.
Then I found these Command Garland Holders, a product made specifically for hanging garland and greens on the fireplace mantle. No more nails.
I am familiar with this brand because I have used other command products in different places in my home. They have been strong enough to hold things, yet have been removable without causing damage.
These look like they will work the same way. I really like that they are green. That way they will blend in even more with my Christmas garland. Always make sure you follow their instructions, especially, make sure you clean the surface the way they suggest, wait the amount of time that is indicated, and follow the weight limit.

title: What can't Command strips do???!
author: D.
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2025
review_text:
I'll echo the other glowing reviews on these garland holders. I think I currently own or have at least used just about every kind of Command product ever produced EXCEPT for these, until now. I like and use their products so frequently that I have a bin in my hall closet dedicated solely to Command strips and hangers. That's some dedication!
When I came across these, I knew I need to also give these a shot. Up until recently, I was using small Command hooks to hold onto my holiday garlands on my mantle. You place the hooks so that the open side is facing the wall, away from the room, and then hook the garland into them and everything stays in place, since gravity wants to pull the hook forward, but the hook is there supporting everything... theoretically. But in the past, at least for Christmas, I have tended to layer my garlands, so having 3 strands trying to all be jammed together and held up by small hooks has presented some challenges that required zip ties and prayer to overcome. Taking that apart last year was an interesting exercise in patience.
These are a game changer! They really accommodate more than just a small hook, are sturdy, don't damage my mantle, and hold up enough weight that I'm not overly concerned that my garland, bells and lights will come crashing down this holiday season. As it stands, these are holding up my fall garland perfectly. You just adhere the base to your mantle, wrap this around the garland stem, and then fasten the end to the base. So easy. I do wish they came with more strips, so that you can get more uses out of one pack before having to spring for another pack of strips, but to be honest, the strips seem to lose their adhesion after sitting for a while (as I've discovered from some of my older strips in my closet Command bin!), so maybe it's best to buy them fresh every time you need them to ensure they're at max stickiness.
Love that they're useable year after year by just replacing the adhesive. I'm going to use these until they wear out (or until something better comes along, though I'm not sure this could be improved upon!).

title: Versatile and Gentle Garland Holders That Blend Right In
author: Joseph Garcia
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2025
review_text:
If you love Command strips in general, you’ll adore these. They’re long enough to easily handle thicker or custom garlands with lots of decorations. The material is a flexible, rubbery kind of plastic that’s easy to bend and adjust, so placing them exactly how you need is a breeze. As any other commend strip they are supper sticky, and can hang anywhere.
One of the best parts is that they come off cleanly without leaving any damage or residue on my mantel or walls. The green color blends perfectly with garlands or even other greenery, so they’re pretty discreet if you want to hang up wreaths or plants. Plus, you get six in a pack, which is great value for decorating multiple spots.
Overall, these holders are a fantastic and damage-free way to display holiday décor or other hanging items. Definitely recommend them!

title: Check the weight and surface. Works well!
author: Courtney
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2025
review_text:
These Command Garland Holders are such a smart and practical solution for decorating without any mess or damage. They make it so easy to hang garlands, wreaths, or other holiday decorations around the fireplace or doorways without worrying about nails, hooks, or sticky residue. The green color blends in nicely with greenery and other seasonal decor, so they don’t stand out or distract from the decorations themselves. They hold surprisingly well for their small size and are a total lifesaver for anyone who loves decorating but hates cleaning up afterward.
The installation is simple and quick. You just peel, stick, and press firmly, and the adhesive feels strong right away. I used them to hold a garland across the fireplace mantel, and they kept it securely in place through the entire season without slipping or loosening. They also come off easily when the holidays are over, leaving the surface completely clean. No marks, no paint peeling, and no residue at all, which is exactly what makes Command products so reliable and worth having on hand.
Each hook can hold up to two pounds, which is enough for most lightweight garlands or wreaths, though if your decor is heavier or especially full, you might need to use a few extra hooks for added support. I love that the pack includes six, which gives you flexibility for different decorating ideas. You can space them out across a mantel, window frame, or banister, and they stay hidden under the greenery for a neat and polished look.
The only small downside is that their holding power does depend on the surface. Smooth, clean surfaces work perfectly, but if your surface is textured or dusty, the adhesive may not stick as firmly. Once you find the right placement though, they perform wonderfully and can easily be reused with new strips next season.
Overall, these garland holders are one of those little things that make holiday decorating so much easier and stress-free. They save time, protect your home from damage, and help you achieve that classic holiday look without the hassle of nails or hooks. I absolutely recommend them for anyone who loves decorating for the holidays but wants everything to look clean and put together when the season is over.

title: Might want to look elsewhere
author: John A.
date: September 29, 2024
review_text: I want to say off the bat I have bought from this company before and this is the first time I have ever run into a problem. I am guessing that they had a bad batch so you might want to take this into consideration when buying. The way this works is both sides have a mushroom head that is pressed into a like matching piece for the other side. Normally you can press and release quite a few times before the tensile strength starts to break down and the holding power is lessened. That wasn't the case with this batch. when I pulled them apart the first time i noticed that allot of the mushroom heads had pulled off and were stuck in the other side. that tells me that something went wrong during the manufacturing process. With the price that you pay for this stuff you would think that the quality assurance would be better. like I said I have bought this exact product in the past and haven't had any problems, but either their QA has dropped or they are using a different supplier and it just isn't the same product as before.
product_title: 3M Dual Lock SJ3550A 1"×8ft Black, Reclosable Fastener Mounting Tape Interlocking Mushroom Shaped Strong Adhesive Hook Lock Sticky Tape Waterproof for Indoor and Outdoor, EZ Pass, Pedalboard, 1 Pack

title: Great adhesive

date: March 11, 2024
review_text: Sometimes I need something that can reliably attach and detach. Old-school Velcro wears out after a while and doesn't bind that great. This all plastic Velcro binds really well, but ones that have cheaper adhesive might detach. Also this all plastic Velcro not likely to wear out anytime soon. The adhesive though is wear this item shines. I'd imagine other plastic velcros might actually detach from the adhesive side. Which would be really annoying. Wipe whatever you attach this to with rubbing alcohol makes sure it's free of any dirt, hair, or oils. So far, adhesive has never detached on me. It's pricey, but the reliability is worth it. I've bought this twice. No question will buy again if needed.

title: Versatile Tape for Mounting Power Banks to Portable Devices like the Steam Deck!
author: Customer Review
date: December 6, 2023
review_text: This mounting tape is perfect for adding portable power bank solutions to handheld devices such as the Steam Deck and Nintendo 3DS! All you have to do is cut two small portions roughly an inch and a half in length and stick them to the flat sides of your devices, one on the handheld and the other on the power bank. I included images showing how I used this method. This tape is perfect if you want to have portable power and you still want to use your existing protective cases without adding too much bulk. The interlocking mechanism of the mounting tape ensures that the attached objects won't fall off so easily! Make sure you get the positioning of the tape correct the first time. If you let the tape settle for too long, the adhesive becomes stronger and more difficult to remove!

title: You're better off getting these at a retail store in town. Don't buy from this seller.
author: C. Trumpis
date: March 26, 2025
review_text: Don't buy from this seller. I've Purchase these same exact hooks from retail stores, but I didn't have time to go to the store this go around. I ordered from Amazon. First and foremost, the hooks do not come in the command hooked packaging like they should. The seller sells them loose in a box. Secondly, the stickers for these are not the same quality as they are in the company packaged command hooks. They are loose in the small box, and they don't stick to things. When they do stick to things, they don't last long. I got these hooks to stick to the wall by my bed, so I can hang my super lightweight eye mask. This is essentially the weight of a small, thin piece of cotton. The hooks fall at the slightest touch, and that is because the wall stickers aren't the right ones for this. Be cautious when being from this seller!! You'll save yourself a lot of time, effort, and money to just go to a retail store in your town and get some. I've already used several of these, only to have them fall down, so it's too late for me to return them. Don't be like me and get them on Amazon. Make the time to get the brand packaged ones from a store. I deeply regret my own laziness and trusting a seller on Amazon like this. I should have known better.
product_title: Command Small Clear Wire Toggle Hooks, 10 Wall Hooks and 12 Command Strips, Damage-Free Hanging with Adhesive, Great for Hanging, Organization and Storage, Holds up to 0.5 lb

title: Reliable, Damage-Free Hanging Solution for Any Space
author: James Williams
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2025
review_text:
Having decorated numerous homes across the U.S., I've come to appreciate tools that simplify the process. The Command 17205-16ES Small Picture Hanging Strips are one such tool that consistently delivers.

These strips are straightforward to use—just peel, stick, and press. They hold firmly, supporting frames up to 4 lbs, making them ideal for small to medium-sized pictures. The real advantage is their damage-free removal; they come off cleanly without leaving holes or sticky residue, preserving the integrity of your walls.

I particularly value their versatility. Whether arranging a gallery wall or hanging seasonal decorations, these strips adapt to various surfaces and layouts. The white color blends seamlessly with most wall paints, maintaining a clean aesthetic.

While they're not suited for heavier items, for everyday decorating needs, these strips are a dependable choice. They've become a staple in my toolkit, simplifying the process of personalizing spaces without the hassle of nails or drills.
product_title: Command Small Wire Toggle Hooks, Damage Free Hanging Wall Hooks with Adhesive Strips, No Tools Wall Hooks for Hanging Organizational Items in Living Spaces, 9 White Hooks and 12 Command Strips

review_text:
All these reviews were clearly written by someone who used these for a short period of time!
Do you like crying kids? Broken glass? Screams? If so these are for you! They work well for a few years. Then all of a sudden at 3am they picture falls off the wall. You hear a bang and your kids start screaming! Be sure when you run out of your room with a bat (thinking a thief broke a window) that you’re wearing shoes! Otherwise you can recreate Die Hard!
No I’m not kidding. These are terrible and I wouldn’t give them as a gift to my worst enemy. I can’t tell you how many broken pictures I’ve had over the years! I’ve had to remove the proactively to make sure more things don’t break.

Stay away!

title: Wall Damage
author: NorthernWoman
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2020
review_text:
I used these hooks in a closet which had been painted several months previously, so there was no smoke, soap, or other residue on the paint. They were applied and removed according to instructions.

About half of them fell off the wall even though nothing had ever been hung on them.

I decided to install a permanent hook system, and when I tried to remove the remaining hooks, they either removed the paint, or the paint and primer, or the paint, primer, and skin of the drywall, damaging the drywall underneath. The spots need to be sanded, reprimed, and repainted. My hook system installation is going to take days instead of several hours.

Thanks a lot, 3M.

title: Convenient and Reliable Solution for Rehanging Bath Accessories!
author: Steven
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2023
review_text:
The Command 170033ES Water-Resistant Adhesive Refill Strips are an essential and reliable solution for rehanging medium and large bath accessories. With their water-resistant design, strong adhesive properties, and hassle-free application, these refill strips have far surpassed my expectations, providing unmatched convenience and versatility for organizing my bathroom.

The standout feature of the Command Water-Resistant Adhesive Refill Strips is their water-resistant quality. The strips are designed to withstand humid and damp bathroom environments, ensuring a secure hold even in areas prone to moisture.

The strong adhesive properties of the strips offer a reliable hold on a variety of surfaces, including tiles, glass, and painted walls, without causing any damage or leaving residue behind.

The pack includes both medium and large refill strips, providing the perfect size options for rehanging various bath accessories, such as towel hooks, shower caddies, and more.

The easy application and removal process of the refill strips make it a breeze to reposition or switch out bath accessories without any tools or additional hardware.

Command is a trusted brand known for its innovative adhesive solutions, and the Water-Resistant Adhesive Refill Strips reflect that commitment. They are a preferred choice for organizing and reorganizing bathroom spaces with ease.

In conclusion, the Command 170033ES Water-Resistant Adhesive Refill Strips are a must-have for anyone seeking a reliable and water-resistant solution for rehanging bath accessories. Their strong adhesive properties, versatile sizes, and easy application make them the ultimate choice for maintaining an organized and functional bathroom. If you're looking for high-quality adhesive strips that withstand bathroom conditions and offer hassle-free repositioning, the Command Water-Resistant Adhesive Refill Strips are the perfect option. I highly recommend these refill strips for their outstanding performance and the convenience they bring to reorganizing my bathroom space!

title: Good for light items
author: Queen Elizabeth
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2020
review_text: I bought these hooks to hold a small toy hammock. I followed the instructions and even let the hooks stick for about an hour on their own before trying to hang the hammock on them. The hammock is made of thin woven threads--almost like mesh. It is laughably light, but there is a little tension when all three points of the hammock are hooked. As soon as I put the empty hammock onto the hooks, the hooks went shooting off the walls (literally!). Fortunately, no paint was ripped off! I tried the whole process a second time with no luck. At least they were easy to remove (obviously). Now, I am using the hooks to hold my COVID-19 masks in the hallway. They seem to work well for very light items, so I'd recommend them for that.

title: Failed Expectations and Fallen Frames — Not Worth the Risk
author: Solid Snake
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2025
review_text:
As someone who’s spent years curating a gallery wall of family photos, travel prints, and framed certificates, I’ve come to rely heavily on damage-free hanging solutions. I’ve used various adhesive strips and hooks over the years, including other Command products, with generally positive results. So when I saw the Command Picture Hanging Strips (Large, White, 17206-ES) claiming to hold up to 16 lbs, I thought I’d found the perfect solution for my heavier frames. Unfortunately, this product turned out to be a costly mistake.

Pros:
Easy to apply: The strips are simple to attach to both the wall and the frame. The click-and-lock mechanism is intuitive and satisfying.

Clean removal (in theory): When they don’t fail prematurely, they do come off without leaving residue or damaging paint.

Cons:
Grossly overstated weight capacity: I used these strips on a 12 lb wooden frame with a glass front—well below the advertised 16 lb limit. Within 48 hours, the frame crashed to the floor, shattering the glass and damaging the corner of the frame. I followed the instructions meticulously: cleaned the wall, pressed firmly, waited the recommended hour before hanging. Still failed.

Inconsistent adhesion: I tried again with a different frame and a fresh set of strips. This time, the strips held for about a week before giving out. The adhesive seems to degrade quickly, especially in rooms with mild humidity (mine was a climate-controlled living room).

Expensive for what you get: At this price point, I expected reliability. Instead, I’m out the cost of the strips and the damage to two frames. For comparison, I’ve had better luck with Gorilla mounting tape and traditional wall anchors, both of which cost less and actually do what they claim.

No warning about surface compatibility: While the packaging mentions “smooth surfaces,” it doesn’t clarify that even painted drywall can be problematic. A more honest disclaimer would’ve saved me the trouble.

Final Thoughts:
I used these strips for two weeks across three different frames, all under the weight limit and on smooth, painted drywall. Two fell, one barely held on. For a product marketed as a reliable alternative to nails and screws, this was a complete letdown. If you’re hanging anything of value—emotionally or financially—look elsewhere. These strips might work for lightweight decor, but they’re absolutely not suited for anything substantial.

Save your walls, your frames, and your money. This product doesn’t deliver on its promise.
product_title: Command 15 lb Large Picture Hanging Strips 4 Pairs (8 Command Strips), Damage-Free Hanging Picture Hangers, No Tools Wall Hanging Strips for Home Decor, White Adhesive Strips

title: Buyer beware, these strips will break your heart
author: HD Outdoors
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 17, 2025
review_text:
Be very wary of this product. We just hung an expensive framed picture with multiple strips (way above the weight limit) and it fell of the wall about 20 minutes later. We tested the "stickiness" of multiple unused strips in the box to rule out it was a coating on the wall or the painting's frame. The unused/new strips were not even moderately sticky. Thus, the cause was the strips being completely defective.

Sadly, the lesson to learn this was a very nice piece of artwork and a damaged wall.

title: Works for an odd purpose
author: P.J.
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 14, 2024
review_text:
I've been unable to find anything to hold my shower rod in place on my smooth tile wall. Nothing has worked. I tried the clear adhesive product you see in the photo (which has worked the best so far) but as you can see it has somehow twisted and will no doubt fail at some point. I'm concerned that my tile will be damaged when the rod crashes down (again), so I came up with this rig. It's unsightly, but I think it'll serve my purpose. I just want something that will break the fall, or hopefully keep it from falling to the floor.
The strips have been stuck on the tile for 2 weeks, and when I tug firmly downward on the string they don't budge. If they stay on the tile, I know they'll support the rod if it falls.
The two strips actually "lock" together, better than velcro. They kind of snap together. As long as they adhere to your surface, they'll definitely stick to each other. Time will tell on this project, to see if the strips continue to stick to the tile.

title: Good option if you can't put nails in your walls
author: Nicole Christensen
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2024
review_text:
I rent my apartment and whiley landlord is okay with a few nails I have more things I wanted to hang than that. Command strips are an awesome option for that!

I've never had a problem using command strips provided you follow the removal directions. If you don't pull directly down they can take off a layer of paint but provided you pull straight down you should be good.

They are also very versatile and live up to the recommended weight thresholds. They are also long lasting. I've had command strips last for well over a year and counting. Awesome product.
product_title: Command 15 lb Large Picture Hanging Strips 4 Pairs (8 Command Strips), Damage-Free Hanging Picture Hangers, No Tools Wall Hanging Strips for Home Decor, White Adhesive Strips
